gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class AppositiveDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.AppositiveDetection

  • public class AppositiveDetection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static utility methods to find and interpret appositives and exemplifications in text.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

        public AppositiveDetection()

    • Method Detail

      • appositive

        public static boolean appositive(SurfaceElement a,
                                 SurfaceElement b)
        Determines whether two textual units are appositives.

        They need to be semantically consonant and syntactically appositive.

        Parameters:
        a - the first textual unit
        b - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual units can be treated as appositives

      • syntacticAppositive

        public static boolean syntacticAppositive(SurfaceElement a,
                                          SurfaceElement b)
        Determines whether two textual units are in a syntactic appositive construction.

        It uses types of dependencies that exist between the textual units, as well as the adjacency of textual units and appositive configuration in a parse tree.

        Parameters:
        a - the first textual unit
        b - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual units can be treated as syntactic appositives

      • hasSyntacticAppositives

        public static boolean hasSyntacticAppositives(SurfaceElement surf)
        Determines whether a textual unit is involved in an appositive indicating syntactic dependency.
        Parameters:
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        true if there is an appositive dependency involving the textual unit

      • hasSyntacticExemplifications

        public static boolean hasSyntacticExemplifications(SurfaceElement surf)
        Determines whether a textual unit is involved in an exemplification indicating syntactic dependency.
        Parameters:
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        true if there is an exemplification dependency involving the textual unit

      • identifySyntacticAppositives

        public static java.util.Set<SurfaceElement> identifySyntacticAppositives(SurfaceElement surf)
        Identifies the textual units that are in an appositive construction with the textual unit surf.

        It relies only on dependency relations.

        Parameters:
        surf - a textual unit
        Returns:
        the set of textual units in an appositive construction with

      • identifyAppositives

        public static java.util.Set<SemanticItem> identifyAppositives(SemanticItem si)
        Identifies semantic items that are in an appositive construction with the semantic item si.

        if si is a complex semantic item with a predicate, the predicate is taken as the basis for recognizing appositives. If it's a relation without a predicate, it returns an empty set. The semantic items returned are semantically compatible with si.

        Parameters:
        si - a semantic item
        Returns:
        the semantic items in an appositive construction with si or its predicate, empty set otherwise

      • syntacticAppositiveFromTree

        public static boolean syntacticAppositiveFromTree(SurfaceElement surf1,
                                                  SurfaceElement surf2)
        Determines whether two textual units are appositives, using the parse tree.
        Parameters:
        surf1 - the first textual unit
        surf2 - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual units are in an appositive construction

      • identifyExemplifications

        public static java.util.Set<SemanticItem> identifyExemplifications(SemanticItem si)
        Identifies semantic items that are in an exemplification relation with the semantic item si.

        It uses syntactic dependencies as well as set phrase e.g. to identify exemplifications. If si is exemplified, it returns all example instances; if it is an example, it returns all items that are exemplified by si. The returned semantic items are semantically consonant with si.

        Parameters:
        si - a semantic item
        Returns:
        the semantic items that are in an exemplification relation with si or its predicate, empty set otherwise

      • exemplifies

        public static boolean exemplifies(SurfaceElement surf,
                                  boolean semanticallyConsonant)
        Determines whether a textual unit exemplifies some other textual unit.

        Semantic consonance check between the exemplifier/example can be turned on/off.

        Parameters:
        surf - a textual unit
        semanticallyConsonant - whether semantic consonance should be considered
        Returns:
        true if surf exemplifies some textual unit

      • exemplifies

        public static boolean exemplifies(SurfaceElement a,
                                  SurfaceElement b,
                                  boolean semanticallyConsonant)
        Determines whether a textual unit a exemplifies some other textual unit b.

        Semantic consonance check between the exemplifier/example can be turned on/off.

        Parameters:
        a - a textual unit
        b - another textual unit
        semanticallyConsonant - whether semantic consonance should be considered
        Returns:
        true if a exemplifies b

      • exempliGratia

        public static boolean exempliGratia(SurfaceElement a,
                                    SurfaceElement b)
        Determines whether there is an exempli gratia (e.g.) between two textual units.
        Parameters:
        a - the first textual unit
        b - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        true if an (e.g., is found

      • exempliGratia

        public static SurfaceElement exempliGratia(SurfaceElement surf)
        Finds the textual unit that surf is an in an e.g., with. if any.

        While not so ad hoc, it only works in specific cases, mostly seen biomedical literature.

        Parameters:
        surf - a textual unit
        Returns:
        true if surf is exemplified with or exemplifies with e.g.
